result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey A Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Green Lake County Clerk of Court

supervisions.notes: To commence immediately.  Sentence is to be consecutive to 2016CF48 and consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bond of $500.00 applied.  Court orders the fine and costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines and/or costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Court orders the fine and costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt:
11:07 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  Sentencing statement by DA Christenson.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2016CF23

1 year of Initial Confinement and 1 year of Extended supervision, consecutive to each other and consecutive to any other sentence.

CONDITIONS:

-$600 fine plus court costs.  Court orders the fine and costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines and/or costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  
-Blood Draw fee - $42.50
-DL revocation - 3 years
-IID - 3 years
-AODA
-DNA sample

Sentence is to commence immediately.  Court grants the defendant 5 days of sentence credit.

Court finds the defendant eligible for the CIP & SAP programs.

2016CF48

2 years of Initial Confinement and 2 years of Extended supervision, consecutive to each other and consecutive to any other sentence.

CONDITIONS:

-$600 fine plus court costs.  Court orders the fine and costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines and/or costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  
-Blood Draw fee - $42.50
-DL revocation - 2 years
-IID - 2 years
-AODA & any foloow-up.
-DNA sample

Sentence is to commence immediately.  Court grants the defendant 109 days of sentence credit.

Court finds the defendant eligible for the CIP & SAP programs.

Court adjourned at 11:31 a.m.
to counsel with a copy of the presentence investigation report
Sentencing hearing on November 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.

11:24 A.M.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to 5th offense with no enhancers and 6th offense with no enhancers and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  DA concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to OWI - 5th offense (count 1) on 2016CF23 and orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in and the court finds the defendant guilty to OWI - 6th offense (Count 5) on 2016CF48 and orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in.  Court strikes the enhancers on counts 1 & 5 be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court orders a pre-sentence investigation be completed and filed with the court within 60 days.  

Court orders the cash bonds in both cases.  Court sets for Sentencing on November 21, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:33 a.m.
Plea hearing on August 30, 2016 at 11:00 am.

11:52 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - just received the blood results on 2016CF48 and have an offer in these cases and requests to be heard on bond in 2016CF48.  Atty Privat requests bond be modified to either a lower cash bond or a signature bond.  Statement by Bob Dore.  Statement by DA regarding bond.  Court denies the request for bond modification.  Court sets for plea hearing on August 30, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.    

Court adjourned at 11:58 a.m
By Atty Barbara Privat
Status hearing on August 23, 2016 at 11:30 am.

11:28 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - waiting on Discovery on the new file and requests an adjournment and to be heard on bond.  Further statement by Atty Privat regarding request for bond modification.  Argument by DA.  Court denies the motion for bond modification on 2016CF48. Court sets for Status Hearing on August 23, 2016 at 11:30 A.M.

Court adjourned at 11:31 a.m.
Status hearing on July 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.

11:17 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by 
Attty Privat, 2016CF48 will be a prelim waiver and requests 2016CF23 be tracked with that case, and defendant will plea to the balance of the cases.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to Counts 1 & 3 in 2015CM72; Count 1 in 2015CF103 and Counts 1 & 3 in 2016CF14.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 3 on 2015CM72, strikes the repeater and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 on 2015CF103 and finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 3 as charged on 2016CF14.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Statement by Bob Dore.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2015CM72 

Count 1

-$100.00 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-DNA Sample

Count 3 

-30 days county jail, with huber.  To commence immediately.
-Court costs.
-DNA sample

2015CF103

-Count 1 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Restitution - $1,467.97
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

2016CF14

Count 1 

-60 days county jail.  
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-DNA sample

Count 3

-30 days county jail.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-DNA sample

All jail sentences are to be consecutive to each other and consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber, to commence immediately.  Court grants out of county travel and out of county service.

Court grants sentence credit as determined by the jail.

16CF48 - Statement by Atty Privat - Defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets 2016CF23 & 2016CF48 for Status Hearing on July 5, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.  

Statement by Atty Privat - requests to address bond on 2016CF48 and requests a signature bond.  Statement by DA Christenson - does not agree with a reduction in bond.  Court denies the defendant's request to modify bond.

Court adjourned at 11:42 a.m.
